sentence.Network_en: A minority of officers were prepared to bend the rules.

sentence.Network_en: Only a minority of the people supported the Revolution.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有少数人支持这场革命。

sentence.Network_en: In the past conservatives have been in the minority.
sentence.Network_cn: 过去保守派一直占少数。

phrase.cizu_name: be (或 find oneself) in a minority of one

jx.jx_en_mean: (often humorous)be the sole person to be in favour of or against something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (常幽默)是孤家寡人；得不到任何支持

jx.jx_en_mean: belonging to or constituting the smaller group or number

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.  (denoting the state of being a minor): from French minorité or medieval Latin minoritas, from Latin minor 'smaller' (see minor)

entry.def: If you talk about a minority of people or things in a larger group, you are referring to a number of them that forms less than half of the larger group, usually much less than half.

example.ex: Local authority nursery provision covers only a tiny minority of working mothers...
example.tran: 当地政府提供的保育服务只有少数上班族母亲才能够享受到。

example.ex: These children are only a small minority.
example.tran: 这些孩子只是很少的一部分。

entry.def: A minority is a group of people of the same race, culture, or religion who live in a place where most of the people around them are of a different race, culture, or religion.

example.ex: Students have called for greater numbers of women and minorities on the faculty...
example.tran: 学生要求聘请更多女教师和少数民族族裔的老师。

means.word_mean: 1. a group of people who differ racially or politically from a larger group of which it is a part
2. being or relating to the smaller in number of two parts;

sentences.sentence: "when the vote was taken they were in the minority"

means.word_mean: 3. any age prior to the legal age

auth_sentence.content: We strongly encourage women and minority candidates to apply.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+min伸出,突出+ent……的→adj.显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的
im进入+min伸出,突出+ent……的→伸进来的→即将发生的
pro向前+min伸+ent……的→向前伸出→杰出的
pre前+eminent突出的→向前突出的→杰出的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 用草写小字写的, 极小的
stems_affixes.word_buile: min小+uscule表形容词或名词→小的→极小的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 卓越的, 极为出色的
stems_affixes.word_buile: super过度,极度+eminent[adj.显赫的;杰出的;有名的;优良的]→adj.卓越的, 极为出色的
min小+or→adj.较小的,较小的 n.兼修学科 v.[in]兼修
minute微小的+ial表形容词→小事件→琐事
min小+us→变少→减去
min小+ute→n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的
e出+min伸出,突出+ence表名词→n.卓越,杰出
pro向前+min伸+ence表名词→向前伸出→杰出
minute[[n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的]]→n.菜单
min小+uscule表形容词或名词→小的→极小的

minor小或者少+ity表名词→少的状态→少数
min小+us→变少→减去
min小+ute→n.分钟,片刻;[n.]会议记录adj.微小的,微细的
min小+us→变少→减去
min小+ify使……化→小化
min小+or→adj.较小的,较小的 n.兼修学科 v.[in]兼修

Sentence.sentence: Some day you may be either a speaker or a listener in a situation involving people from other countries or members of minority group in North America.
In some cultures, both overseas and in some minority groups in North America, listeners are considered disrespectful if they look directly at the speaker

sentences.en: Only a minority of British households do not have a car.
sentences.cn: 英国只有少数家庭没有汽车。

means.word_mean: 少数民族, 少数信仰不同的人

sentences.en: The interests of the minorities should be protected.
sentences.cn: 少数民族的利益应该得到保护。

jushi.english: Only a minority of British households do〔does〕not have a car.
jushi.chinese: 英国只有少数家庭没有汽车。

jushi.english: The minority is subordinate to the majority.
Three numbers of the committee disagreed with the main report, so they produced a minority report.
jushi.chinese: 委员会中三名委员不同意该主要报告,因此他们提出一个代表少数人意见的报告。
